sentence.text: ________ stimulates ___ production in dose-dependent fashion as well

Phosphoinositide hydrolysis, resulting in ______________________ (IP3) and diacylglycerol (DG) formation, has been implicated in ________-stimulated pulsatile secretion of prostaglandin F2 alpha (PGF2 alpha) from uterine endometrium of sheep and other mammals

SP ewes also had greater incorporation of [3H]inositol into ______________________ (IP3) (+3449%, p less than 0.01) and total __________________ (IP) (+760%, p less than 0.08), in response to ________, than did oCSP ewes (+553 and +168% for ___ and total __, respectively) in endometrium collected at ovariectomy/hysterectomy on Day 16
These results indicate that oTP-1 may prevent luteolysis by inhibiting development of endometrial responsiveness to ________ and, therefore, reduce ________-induced synthesis of ___ and PGF2 alpha
____________________________ and ________ binding in human myometrium

The effects of prostaglandin F2 alpha (PGF2 alpha) on intracellular Ca2+ concentration ([Ca2+]i) and __________________ (IP) generation in human myometrial cells were evaluated and compared to the effects of ________
In contrast, the potencies of ________ to raise __ and [Ca2+]i were similar and independent of extracellular Ca2+, and could be suppressed by pertussis toxin and phorbol ester, but not by verapamil

The action of PGF2 alpha depends on extracellular Ca2+, whereas ________ activates the G-protein-dependent phospholipase-C-___-Ca2+ signal-transducing pathway, complemented by the influx of extracellular Ca2+

The objectives of this study were to evaluate and compare the actions of endothelin-1 (ET-1), ________, prostaglandin F2 alpha (PGF2 alpha) and ____________________________ (IP3) on 45Ca2+ mobilization in permeabilized rat myometrial cells and to examine the activation of the inositol lipid cycle in intact myocytes
All four agonists caused a biphasic release of 45Ca2+ from non-mitochondrial pool(s), with the rank order of potency: ________ > PGF2 alpha > ET-1 > ___

Endothelin-1 and ________ stimulated __________________ accumulation at concentrations similar to those that promoted 45Ca2+ efflux, whereas about 100 times higher concentrations of PGF2 alpha were needed to activate this signaling pathway in intact cells

It is concluded that the primary action of PGF2 alpha in myometrial cells is to enhance Ca2+ influx, whereas ________ and ET-1 receptors are coupled to phospholipase C, generating ___ and raising the intracellular concentration of free Ca2+ from intracellular as well as extracellular sources

________ induced a biphasic increase in the intracellular Ca2+ concentration of porcine myometrial cells: participation of a pertussis toxin-insensitive G-protein, ____________________________-sensitive Ca2+ pool, and Ca2+ channels
Administration of __ (1 microM) for 15 sec increased ____________________________ (IP3) formation by 61%
Pretreatment with pertussis toxin (PTX, 1 microgram/ml) for 2 hr failed to alter the __-induced increase in [Ca2+]i and ___ formation
U-73122 (3 microM) also abolished the __-induced ___ formation
_______ beta protein disruption of cholinergic and growth factor _______________ signals could underlie cognitive and neurodegerative aspects of Alzheimer's disease
_______ beta protein (25-35) stimulation of ______________ A, C and D activities of LA-N-2 cells
[3H]Inositol prelabeled LA-N-2 cells were exposed to varying concentrations of ________, from 20 to 125 micrograms/ml, and _______________ activation was measured
The effects of adrenergic, metabotropic amino acid and bombesin antagonists on the ________ mediated stimulation of _______________ activity was investigated

Propranolol, a beta adrenergic antagonist, 7-chloro-kynurenic acid, a metabotropic amino acid antagonist, and [Tyr4-D-Phe12]bombesin, a bombesin antagonist, blunted the ________ stimulation of _______________ activity in [3H]inositol prelabeled LA-N-2 cells
This suggests that _______ beta protein activation of _______________ may be receptor mediated
The _______________ inhibitor U 71322 prevented the activation of _______________ by ________
These results suggest that _____ secretion and ______ production in NT2N neurons are regulated by the muscarinic/_______________ signal transduction pathway

Current interest in reducing heart disease risks by diet involves attention to total fat; saturated, monounsaturated, polyunsaturated and trans fatty acids, as well as dietary ___________, soluble fiber, salt, alcohol, antioxidants, dietary alterations causing homocysteinemia and other dietary constituents, such as _________ compounds in some soy products
This indicates that the calcium response to __ application was principally associated with activation of the ___-sensitive calcium stores
The beta _______ protein fragments had diverse effects on phosphoinositide-specific _______________ (PI-PLC) as assayed in rat cortical membranes
They are needed for the catabolism of ___________, bile acids, and steroid hormones; they hydrolyze a number of _________ glycosides to anticarcinogens; and they detoxify certain carcinogens

The aim of this study was to investigate the effects of hCG, hCG plus ________ and ________ on [3H] __________________ (IP) formations in porcine myometrial cells obtained from ovariectomized and cyclic gilts

The highest production of total ___________________ (d.p.m.) was found in cells from ovariectomized gilts given in vivo estradiol benzoate and progesterone for five consecutive days and treated with 1000 mU hCG and 100 mU hCG plus 1 microM ________ (984 +/- 84 and 1063 +/- 131 vs 314 +/- 36, respectively)
There was also a very significant increase of ___ after the addition of 1000 mU hCG (p < 0.001) and ___ and ___ when 1000 mU hCG plus ________ were added (p < 0.001 and p < 0.01, respectively)
Only ________ alone increased the formation of ___ in cells from ovariectomized pigs treated with estradiol in vivo (p < 0.01)
The highest dose of hCG plus The highest dose of hCG plus ________ provoked accumulation of total [3H]__________________ (p < 0.05) 53% over the basal level on days 21/1 of the estrous cycle
The present study demonstrates that hCG and ________ can increase the accumulation of ___________________ in porcine myometrial cells

The relative risks between highest and lowest quarters of _________ intake adjusted for age, smoking, serum ___________ concentration, blood pressure, and body mass index were 0.69 (95% confidence interval 0.53 to 0.90) and 0.54 (0.33 to 0.87) for total and coronary mortality, respectively

Granulosa cells were isolated from bovine preovulatory follicles and cultured for 3 days with or without __ in medium supplemented with either _______ (1 microgram/ml) + 1% fetal calf serum (FCS), which maintains basal estradiol secretion, or low doses of FSH (1 and 2 ng/ml) + 1% FCS, a culture condition that maximizes effects of FSH on estradiol secretion

We propose that __ binds to specific OT receptors (OTR) on the endometrium to stimulate phosphoinositide (PI) hydrolysis, thereby activating the inositol trisphosphate (___)-diacylglycerol (DAG) second-messenger system to promote pulsatile PGF2 alpha secretion
Endometrial ___ was increased within 30 seconds after __ treatment and preceded the increase in PGF2 alpha release stimulated by __

These results support the hypothesis that __ stimulates phospholipase C to hydrolyze PI, yielding ___ and DAG second-messengers which promote endometrial PGF2 alpha release during CL regression in pigs

These data suggest that cAMP-dependent phosphorylation at a step involving GTP-binding protein/PLC coupling can exert a negative effect on the stimulation of ___ formation by ________ and thereby affect contraction/relaxation in the myometrium

Once the abnormally phosphorylated abnormal _____________ isoform agent is initiated, any stress event ensuing in adult life induces a nerve growth factor-mediated synthesis of normal cellular _____________ isoform that aggregates to abnormally phosphorylated abnormal _____________ isoform, thereby becoming 'infected'/transformed into the same; due to the vicious circle of positive feedback invoked by the blocking of a _____________-specific ______

The resulting abnormally phosphorylated _____ aggregates to freshly synthesized ____, transforming it into same; due to a system of positive feedback invoked by the organophosphate-induced blockage of a _____________-specific ______________.

The aim of the present study was to investigate how ________ given subcutaneously (SC) and intracerebroventricularly (ICV) influences the secretion of _______, glucagon and glucose and to investigate whether the effect on these variables of suckling in lactating rats is mediated by oxytocinergic mechanisms
Subcutaneous injections of ________ increased _______, glucagon and glucose levels significantly
Two nanograms ________ given ICV had no effect on glucagon and glucose levels but caused a significant rise in _______ levels at this time point

The ________ antagonist 1-deamino-2-D-Tyr-(OEt)-4-Thr-8-Orn-oxytocin administered ICV increased _______ levels itself and therefore the effect on ________-induced _______ secretion was difficult to evaluate
Intracerebroventricular injections of 200 ng ________ caused a significant rise not only of _______ but also of glucagon and glucose levels
In contrast, nanogram amounts of ________ administered ICV cause a rise of _______ levels

The responses of serum ________ (OT) and vasopressin (AVP) to the serotonergic HT1A agonist buspirone (15 mg p.o.) or the HTD1 agonist sumatriptan (6 mg injected subcutaneously) were evaluated in 7 normal men either in basal conditions or during an _______ (0.15 iu/kg as an i.v. bolus) tolerance test (ITT)
Stimulation of 5HT-1D receptors with sumatriptan was unable to change neither AVP nor __ response to _______-induced hypoglycemia
The SGR and RGR also had different endocrine profiles with, for example, twice as high ________ (p < 0.01) and _______ levels (p < 0.01) in RGR compared to the SGR
8-OH-DPAT also increased _______ and decreased CCK and somatostatin levels, effects that were blocked by pretreatment with the ________ antagonist
Taken together, these data suggest that the effect of 8-OH-DPAT on plasma levels of _______, somatostatin and CCK may be mediated by ________
In previous experiments, we have shown that following i.c.v. application of ________, plasma levels of _______ are increased through a cholinergic mechanism
In HVSMC both ________ and AVP increased ____________________________ (IP3) production and [Ca2+]i response, but the efficacy of the responses was greater for ________ than AVP
__ may rapidly stimulate ______________________________ (IP3) and diacylglycerol (DAG) formation, consistent with the concept of rapid activation of a second-messenger system
In support of this hypothesis, endometrial ___ levels were increased (P < 0.05) within 0.5 min after treatment with 0.1 microM __
These results indicate that __ induces endometrial ___ production in a rapid manner indicative of a second-messenger system
Gamma-aminobutyric acid mediation of the inhibitory effect of nitric oxide on the arginine vasopressin and ________ responses to _______-induced hypoglycemia

Previous studies have demonstrated that the nitric oxide (NO) synthase inhibitor L-NAME exerts positive effects on the arginine vasopressin (AVP) and ________ (OT) responses to _______-induced hypoglycemia, suggesting inhibitory actions of NO

AVP and __ secretory patterns during _______ (0.15 IU/kg, i.v.)-tolerance tests (ITT) were examined in seven normal male subjects with (experimental tests) and without (control test) concomitant treatment with L-NAME (40 micrograms/kg injected plus 50 micrograms/kg infused, i.v.), the GABAergic agent sodium valproate (600 mg in three divided doses orally) or the combination of L-NAME and sodium valproate
_______-induced hypoglycemia increased by 2-fold (peak vs. baseline) plasma AVP and __ levels
These data indicate a GABAergic mediation of the inhibitory modulation by NO of the AVP and __ responses to _______-induced hypoglycemia
Correlation between the stimulatory effect of ________ on the formation of ___________________ and the oxytocin receptor level in the pregnant rabbit myometrium

OBJECTIVE: In order to elucidate the roles of ______________________ (IP3) and oxytocin (OT) receptors in rabbit parturition, the concentration of ___ induced by __ and the OT receptor levels were determined in rabbit myometria before and after parturition

METHODS: The effects of __ on ___ formation and OT receptor levels were determined in the myometria of non-pregnant rabbits, Days 26, 28 and 30 of pregnancy rabbits, postpartum rabbits within 12 hours and steroid-treated ovariectomized rabbits
RESULTS: OT receptors were not detectable in the myometria of non-pregnant rabbits, and __ had no effect on the formation of ___________________ (IPs)
On Day 28 of pregnancy, OT receptors became detectable, and then __ could induce the formation of ___
Thereafter, the stimulatory effects of __ on ___ formation and the OT receptor levels dramatically increased toward the end of pregnancy and reduced rapidly after parturition
When the ovariectomized pregnant rabbits were treated with estrogen, OT receptors in the myometrium were induced, and __ acquired the ability to stimulate ___ formation
In addition, an OT receptor antagonist inhibited the stimulatory effects of __ on ___ formation
CONCLUSIONS: These results suggest that the formation of ___ by __, the OT receptor levels in the myometrium, and the production of PGF2 in the decidua might play crucial roles in parturition
Immunohistochemical localization of ______ and __________________ in white and brown adipose tissue

To establish the cell type expressing ______, we also assessed the size and organization of lipid droplets, the ultrastructural features of mitochondria, and the presence or absence of __________________, a brown fat-specific marker
In brown adipose tissue of lean animals, multilocular __________________ (UCP)-positive brown adipocytes had typical brown mitochondria and were ______-negative, both in fed and fasted conditions

At the periphery of the interscapular brown adipose tissue depot, unilocular, ___-negative adipocytes (mean diameter: 41.55 microns) with white-type mitochondria were observed, and these cells were ______-positive
In obese (db/db) animals, brown fat was composed mainly of small unilocular, ___-positive adipocytes (mean diameter: 40.08 microns), which were also ______-positive
In summary, classical brown adipocytes differ from white adipocytes, not only by their morphology and ___ expression, but also by their apparent lack of detectable ______ expression
Wortmannin converts _______ but not ________ from an antilipolytic to a lipolytic agent in the presence of forskolin
The present studies compared the effects of _______ in rat adipocytes with the effects of ________ and peroxovanadate, which mimic some effects of _______
The antilipolytic effects of peroxovanadate and ________ were unaffected by 500 nmol/L wortmannin, which blocked the antilipolytic action of _______
The data provide additional support for the hypothesis that ________ and peroxovanadate affect adipose tissue metabolism by mechanisms distinctly different from those involved in _______ action

These findings support the concept that the mitochondrial metabolism of nutrient molecules is an event sufficient to acutely augment _______ release from the beta cell, to increase _______________-mediated phosphoinositide hydrolysis, and to induce time-dependent potentiation of _______ secretion

2) IGF-1, IGF-2, and _______ also induced a Ca2+ mobilization from the endoplasmic reticulum: _______________ (PLC) inhibitors, neomycin, or U-73122 partially blocked the intracellular [Ca2+]i increase induced by IGF-1 and _______ and totally inhibited the effect of IGF-2
Homogeneous liposome immunoassay for _______ using _______________ from Clostridium perfringens

_______ was conjugated to _______________ by a three-step procedure with hetero-bifunctional crosslinking reagents, succinimidyl 4-(N-maleimidomethyl)cyclohexane-1-carboxylate and 3-(2-pyridyldithio)propionic acid N-hydroxysuccinimide ester
Both p-nitrophenylphosphatidylcholine hydrolytic activity and liposome lytic activity of _______-_______________ conjugate were inhibited in the presence of _______ antiserum
Roles of GTP and _______________ in the potentiation of Ca(2+)-induced _______ secretion by glucose in rat pancreatic islets

There was a 98% greater augmentation of _______ secretion by 16.7 mM glucose (in the presence of diazoxide and 40 mM K+) in primed islets; however, the ability of high glucose to augment ___ activity bore no relationship to the secretory response
MPA markedly inhibited ___ in both conditions; however, _______ secretion was only inhibited (by 46%) in primed islets

These data indicate that an adequate level of GTP is critical for glucose's potentiation of Ca(2+)-induced _______ secretion in primed islets but that ___ activation can clearly be dissociated from _______ secretion and therefore cannot be the major cause of glucose's augmentation of Ca(2+)-induced _______ secretion
Regulation of _______ secretion via ATP-sensitive K+ channel independent mechanisms: role of _______________

The further addition of carbachol, an agonist that activates an isozyme of _______________ distinct from that activated by glucose, together with K+, 20 mM glucose, plus diazoxide resulted in a sustained amplification of _______ secretion from mouse but not rat islets

The inability to activate a nutrient- and calcium-regulated _______________ isozyme in mouse islets to the same extent as in rat islets appears to account, at least in part, for these different _______ secretory responses under these unique conditions
Induction by ______ of ____________________ and enzymes of fatty acid oxidation
Here we show that ______ alters in pancreatic islets the mRNA of the genes encoding enzymes of free fatty acid metabolism and ____________________ (UCP-2)
______ overexpression increased _____ mRNA by more than 10-fold in epididymal, retroperitoneal, and subcutaneous fat tissue of normal, but not of leptin-receptor-defective obese rats
By directly regulating the expression of enzymes of free fatty acid metabolism and of _____, ______ controls intracellular triglyceride content of certain nonadipocytes, as well as adipocytes

Further, the ________-induced activation of IK(sl) was effectively antagonized by 5 x 10(-8) mol/l U-73122 or 5 x 10(-6) mol/l 2-nitro-4-carboxyphenyl N,N-diphenylcarbamate (inhibitors of the cell membrane phospholipase C), as well as by intracellularly applied heparin (selective inhibitor of ____________________________ (IP3)-induced Ca2+ release channels)

The data obtained suggest (i) that selective ________ receptors are present on the membranes of guinea-pig antral smooth muscle cells, (ii) that the oxytocin-related relaxation may result from the activation of Ca(2+)-sensitive K+ conductivity via activation of ___-induced release of Ca2+ from the submembrane located cisternae of the sarcoplasmic reticulum Ca2+ stores and (iii) in turn, this evokes a non-inactivating component of IK, hyperpolarizing the cell membrane

Cellular preincubation with 200 microg/ml antibodies against the inositolphosphoglycan (IPG) moiety of the GPI-anchor (Ab(IPG)), or depletion in GPI-anchored proteins by cellular pretreatment with 0.5 U/ml PI-___, 1 mM _______ and 2 HU/ml streptolysin-O, or depletion in membrane cholesterol content by filipin (5 microg/ml), digitonin (5 microg/ml) and cholesterol oxidase (0.5 U/ml) decreases the HDL3-signal, suggesting the involvement of a lipolytic cleavage of GPI-anchored proteins
______ increases __________________ expression and energy expenditure
______ increased BAT ___ mRNA levels greater than twofold in both ad libitum-fed and food-restricted rats

These data demonstrate a ______-induced increase in energy expenditure in nonmutant rodents and suggest that one mechanism by which ______ increases energy expenditure is through increased thermogenesis in BAT, including increased expression of ___
____________________ is a mediator of thermogenesis regulated by thyroid hormone, beta3-adrenergic agonists, and ______
____ mRNA levels were also regulated by dexamethasone, ______, and starvation, albeit differently in muscle and brown adipose tissue

This effect is maximal at 10(-8) M ___ (a concentration clearly above the normal physiological range of ___ concentrations) and involves the V2 receptor pathway, while activation of ________________ or changes in intracellular calcium are ineffective
After ________________ activity was functionally depleted by treating cells with phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate for 24 hours, ___ did not augment IL-1beta-induced NO production
The effect of ___ was also inhibited in the presence of the ________________ inhibitor calphostin C
The addition of ___ increased ________________ activity in cardiac myocytes, and its effect was significantly inhibited in the presence of calphostin C

These results support the hypothesis that the heart may be a target organ for ___ and that ___ modulates IL-1beta-induced iNOS expression in myocytes through the V1a receptor, which is mediated at least partially via activation of ________________
Activation of EGFR overexpressing 3T3-L1 adipocytes leads to a 3.4 +/- 1.2-fold stimulation of ___ activity over basal levels vs. only 1.06 +/- 0.01-fold stimulation by _______.
Despite the low levels of _______-induced ___ activity, _______-stimulated glucose transport activity was similarly inhibited by U73122 (55.9 +/- 13.1% inhibition)

Inhibition of ___ activation did not impair either EGF- or _______-induced activation of glycogen synthase or incorporation of glucose into lipid, supporting the hypothesis that both EGF- and _______-induced glucose disposal can be independent of GLUT4-mediated glucose transport.
The diminution of glucose transport secondary to inhibition of ___ activity was reflected by a decrease in GLUT4 translocation to the plasma membrane upon either EGF or _______ stimulation
We have recently shown that ___ causes a ________________ (PKC)-dependent increase in ACTH release and biosynthesis in ovine anterior pituitary cells

In these cells, ___ also causes the translocation of ___ from the cytosol to the cell membrane which is maximal at 5 min, but the intracellular events distal to ________________ activation that underlie ACTH secretion have not been well characterized to date

Since the MARCKS protein has been implicated in neurosecretion and is phosphorylated by ___ in synaptosomes, studies were carried out to determine whether ___ might cause MARCKS phosphorylation in the ovine anterior pituitary, and to determine whether this phenomenon might be temporally correlated with ___ translocation and the release of ACTH

We conclude that: (1) ___ causes a rapid, and reversible, phosphorylation of the MARCKS protein in the ovine anterior pituitary; (2) since the ___-induced increase in MARCKS phosphorylation occurs much earlier in these cells than does ___ trans-location, MARCKS phosphorylation may provide a more sensitive index of the onset of ___ activation than the translocation assay; (3) the close temporal association between MARCKS phosphorylation and the rapid early release of ACTH suggests that MARCKS phosphorylation may be involved in the initial intracellular events that underly exocytosis of the hormone.
The activity of the MAPKs, induced by ___ or PMA was inhibited by downregulation of ________________ (PKC), by the tyrosine kinase inhibitor genistein and by MAPK kinase (MEK) inhibitor, PD98059
We suggest that ___ activates the 42/44kDa MAPKs through a signal transduction pathway that involves stimulation of AVP-V1 receptor, tyrosine kinase, ___ and MEK
Secreted form of ____________ precursor protein activates protein kinase C and _____________________ in cultured embryonic rat neocortical cells
Furthermore, we demonstrate that tyrosine phosphorylation of _____________________ and formation of inositol 1,4,5-trisphosphate were increased by _______-stimulation

________-treated male rats had increased circulating levels of cholecystokinin, a tendency to increased plasma levels of _______ (p = 0.066), and relatively more adipose tissue in the thigh and interscapular region, compared with controls
However, in brown fat, we observed a 2-3-fold increase in the expression of ____ in response to dietary fat challenge, which may be related to diet-induced elevations in plasma ______ levels
___________-induced activation of ________________ in renal epithelial cells

___ induced a biphasic increase in diacylglycerol generation, characterized by an initial rapid rise and then a sustained elevation, and ___ activation, reflected by phosphorylation of a specific 80 kDa myristoylated alanine-rich PKC substrate (MARCKS)
These results argue that Ca(2+)-dependent ___ is involved in the action of ___, and that of other agonists, which stimulate sodium transport

However, the ___-dependent stimulation required activation of ________________ (PKC), whereas the inhibition was ___ independent, indicating that the NGF-induced signaling pathways leading to inhibition and stimulation of HCO3- absorption are distinct
Association of the insulin receptor with _____________________ (PLCgamma) in 3T3-L1 adipocytes suggests a role for ________ in metabolic signaling by _______

To determine the functional significance of the interaction of ________ and the IR, we used a specific inhibitor of ___, U73122, or microinjection of SH2 domain glutathione S-transferase fusion proteins derived from ________ to block _______-stimulated GLUT4 translocation
Inhibition of 5-HT3 serotonergic receptors with ondansetron (4 or 8 mg) did not modify the basal secretion of AVP and __ and the __ response to _______-induced hypoglycemia
HvSPY coexpression largely abolished ___-induced activity of an _____________ promoter.

Treatment with (+)-trifluoro-ABA strongly inhibited the ________________-inducible expression of _____________ I-1 encoded by RAmy1A in the aleurone layers of embryoless half-seeds at the levels of transcription, protein synthesis, and enzyme activity

Furthermore, treatment of isolated rat diaphragms and adipocytes with PIG-P as well as with other agents exerting partially _______-mimetic activity, such as PI-specific _______________ (PLC) and the sulfonylurea glimepiride, triggered tyrosine phosphorylation of the caveolar marker protein caveolin, which was apparently correlated with stimulation of lipogenesis
Strikingly, in adipocytes subjected to combined trypsin/salt treatment, PIG-P, PI-specific ___, and glimepiride failed completely to provoke _______-mimetic effects
Chronic central ______ infusion enhances insulin-stimulated glucose metabolism and favors the expression of ___________________
In marked contrast, intracerebroventricular ______ administration was accompanied by the maintenance of high ____, ____, and ____ expression in all these tissues
While ______ maintains or favors energy-dissipating mechanisms (____, ____, and ____), the latter are markedly depressed in pair-fed rats
Melatonin inhibits ________ response to _______-induced hypoglycemia, but not to angiotensin II in normal men

In order to establish whether melatonin alters basal and/or stimulated ________ secretion, 18 normal men were treated (p.o.) with 6 or 12 mg melatonin or placebo in basal conditions (N-6 subjects) or concomitantly to the administration of _______ (O.15 IU/kg body weight in an i.v. bolus) (N-6 subjects) or angiotensin II (increasing doses of 4, 8 and 16 ng/kg/min, at intervals of 20 min)
In contrast, the ________ response to _______-induced hypoglycemia was significantly reduced by melatonin treatment

Although osmotic stimuli cause an increase in nitric oxide synthase (NOS) activity as well as synthesis of AVP and ________ in the paraventricular (PVN) and supraoptic nuclei (SON), it is not known whether NOS activity in the hypothalamus changes in the diabetic patients who have plasma hyperosmolality with hyperglycaemia caused by _______ deficiency

Three weeks after administration of STZ, the diabetic rats were subcutaneously treated with _______ for 1 week, which resulted in significant suppression of the induction of nNOS, AVP and ________ gene expression in the PVN and SON
__ evokes the release of Ca2+ from ___-sensitive intracellular stores

To explore the possible roles of the hypothalamic melanocortin system in ______ action, we examined the effects of intracerebroventricular (i.c.v.) injection of ______ with or without SHU9119, a potent antagonist of alpha-melanocyte stimulating hormone, on food intake, body weight, and mitochondrial ____________________ (UCP-1) mRNA expression in the brown adipose tissue (BAT) in rats
A single i.c.v. injection of ______ decreased cumulative food intake and body weight gain, and increased _____ mRNA expression during 3 h at the onset of the dark phase
Co-injection of SHU9119 also inhibited completely the ______-induced increase in _____ mRNA expression in the BAT
It has been established that _______ beta peptide (AbetaP) activates phospholipase A2, _______________ and phospholipase D of LA-N-2 cells and other cell types
(-)Nicotine did not blunt the ______ activation of _______________
Neural site of ______ influence on neuropeptide Y signaling pathways altering feeding and __________________
NPY in the PVN increases feeding and decreases __________________ (UCP) activity in brown fat, whereas ______ decreases NPY biosynthesis in the Arc, which presumably decreases PVN NPY
Next, we determined that ______ decreases NPY and increases ___ gene expression
Furthermore, immunocytochemical studies showed the ______-induced neuronal MAC expression on the SH-SY5Y cells after CD59 was removed by _____ or blocked by anti-CD59 antibody
Effect of residual endogenous _______ secretion on the abnormal ________ response to hypoglycaemia in _______-dependent diabetics
Since previous studies showed that AVP secretion is influenced by the persistence of residual endogenous _______ secretion, we wondered whether this factor also regulates __ secretion
DESIGN: Case-control study: the __ response to _______-induced hypoglycaemia was measured in normal and diabetic patients with or without residual endogenous _______ secretion
Blood samples for __ assay were taken just before the rapid injection of _______ (time 0) and at time 15, 30, 45 and 60 min
CONCLUSIONS: These data indicate that a residual endogenous _______ secretion exerts a partial protective action against the hypothalamic-pituitary disorder affecting the __ secretory system in IDDM
A barley gene encoding a novel DNA-binding protein (HRT) was identified by southwestern screening with baits containing a ___________ phytohormone response element from an _____________ promoter

These observations suggest that bradykinin, like ________, activates phospholipase C which generates ___ with a subsequent release of Ca2+ from intracellular stores followed by store-operated Ca2+ influx

These findings led us to conclude that inositol trisphosphate [corrected] causes Ca2+ mobilization by muscarinic activation of ___, leading to intracellular translocation of _______ granules to the ready-releasable pool in pancreatic beta-cells via Ca2+/calmodulin-dependent phosphorylation of myosin light chains

To elucidate the pathophysiologic significance of ____ and ____ in the effect of TZDs on glucose metabolism and energy expenditure, we examined their basal mRNA levels in the WAT, brown adipose tissue (BAT), and skeletal muscle from Wistar fatty rats, a rat model of NIDDM and obesity with ______ receptor defect, and investigated expression of the genes encoding ____ and ____ in Wistar fatty rats and in Wistar lean rats with 2-week oral administration of 3 mg x kg(-1) x day(-1) pioglitazone, a TZD derivative

These results clearly demonstrate that ____ gene expression is upregulated by TZDs in the WAT and BAT in Wistar fatty rats, an obese model with ______ receptor defect, and that adipose ____ gene expression is increased in response to TZDs in vitro
____, ____ and ______ gene expression: modulation by food restriction and ______

To determine the effects of food restriction and ______ administration on several transcripts involved in energy homeostasis, we examined ______, ___________________ (UCP) 1, 2 and 3, lipoprotein lipase (LPL), beta3-adrenergic receptors (beta3AR) and hormone-sensitive lipase (HSL) mRNA levels in brown adipose tissue (BAT) and epididymal (EWAT) and perirenal (PWAT) white adipose tissue in three groups of rats
______ increased LPL mRNA by 80%, ____ mRNA twofold, and ____ mRNA levels by 62% in BAT, and increased ____ mRNA levels twofold in EWAT

The present study indicates that ______ increases the gene expression of ____ in EWAT and that of ____, ____ and LPL in BAT, whereas reduced food consumption but not leptin, decreases LPL expression in WAT
DNase1 footprints suggest the involvement of at least three types of transcription factors in the regulation of ____________ by ___________
The regulation of __________ genes by __ therefore involves an interplay of at least three different types of transcription factor
Oxytocin-stimulated _______ release in a clonal beta-cell line RINm5F: involvement of _______________-dependent and -independent pathways.
CONCLUSION: Oxy increases _______ release through both ___ and non-PLC mediated signal transduction mechanisms.
In addition, U-73122 diminished the ___-induced increase in intracellular concentration of _____________________________ (IP3)

U-73122 at 8 mumol.L-1 totally abolished the ___-induced increases in [Ca2+]i and ___; however it reduced the ___-induced increase in insulin release only by 36% and 63% in the monolayer and suspended cell preparations, respectively
________-stimulated _______ release in a clonal beta-cell line RINm5F: involvement of phospholipase C-dependent and -independent pathways
AIM: To study the mechanisms underlying ________ (Oxy)-induced _______ release
RESULTS: ___ increased _______ release and [Ca2+]i in a concentration-dependent manner
___-induced _______ release was not altered by pretreatment with pertussis toxin (PT)

U-73122 at 8 mumol.L-1 totally abolished the ___-induced increases in [Ca2+]i and IP3; however it reduced the ___-induced increase in _______ release only by 36% and 63% in the monolayer and suspended cell preparations, respectively
CONCLUSION: ___ increases _______ release through both PLC and non-PLC mediated signal transduction mechanisms
In isolated adipocytes, the loss of almost half the 18S RNA content over a 24-hour incubation was prevented in the presence of _______ but not ________ or epidermal growth factor (EGF)

Further investigation suggested that activation of ________________ (PKC), which is part of the ___-induced intracellular signalling pathway, is necessary and sufficient for the generation of the synergistic response, although it is not obligatory for ___-induced ACTH release
________ (OT) is more expressed in the TEC/TNC than vasopressin (VP); insulin-like growth factor 2 (IGF-2) thymic expression predominates over IGF-1, and much more over ____________
Thus, __ was proposed to be the self antigen of the neurohypophysial family, and IGF-2 the self antigen precursor of the _______ family
Downregulation of ____________________ mRNA in white adipose tissue and ____________________ mRNA in skeletal muscle during the early stages of ______ treatment
______ by intravenous or intracerebroventricular infusion for 5 h was associated with a decrease in _____ mRNA in WAT (47-52%) and _____ mRNA in SM (33-37%)
Denervation suppressed mRNA levels for _____ (49%), _____ (36%), and COX-IV (59%) and eliminated the acute response to ______ in SM
The specific ________________ (PKC) inhibitor chelerythrine (5 micrometers) inhibited PTH-, ___-, PGE2-, and adenosine-stimulated Ca2+ reabsorption by 77%, 67%, 79%, and 100%, respectively

Co-expression of PLD1 with __________________________ has the same effect, while co-expression of PLD2 with ________ allows PLD2 activity to be stimulated in an _______-dependent manner.

The PKC-specific inhibitors bisindolylmaleimide and Go 6976 abolish _______-induced PLD2 activation in HEK-293 cells co-expressing the insulin receptor, ________ and PLD2, confirming that not only PLD1, but PLD2 as well, is regulated in a PKC-dependent manner.

In summary, we demonstrate that _______ treatment results in activation of both PLD1 and PLD2 in appropriate cell types when the appropriate upstream intermediate signalling components, i.e. PKCalpha and ________, are expressed at sufficient levels.

Both receive information about the nutritional status and the level of energy storage through insulin and ______ signaling mediated by specific receptors located on POMC and ___ neurons present predominantly in the arcuate nucleus (ARC).

When ______ signaling is defective, through a defect in either the receptor (Zucker fa/fa rat, cp/cp rat, and db/db mouse) or in the peptide itself (ob/ob mouse), the ___ system is upregulated as shown by mRNA overexpression and increased peptide release, whereas the content and/or release of some inhibitory peptides (neurotensin, cholecystokinin) are diminished.

We also show that ____ counteracts the inhibition of calmodulin phosphorylation promoted by the regulatory beta subunits of ___
A truncated form of ____ encompassing the C-terminal domain (residues 105-242) interacts with ___ but does not affect its catalytic activity
These results disclose the potential of the ___ to modulate the activity of ___, a pleiotropic ______________ that is particularly abundant in the brain
Arcuate nucleus ___ mRNA increased in rats given protein-free diet, correlating with ______ rather than decreased feeding
The induction of _____________ triggered by ________________ in barley embryos is repressed by sugars
